MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript.
## Ruby Usage For Ruby access to the RHOM database please see the [Rhom Ruby API guide](/api/rhom-api).

METHOD.name: deleteAll
METHOD.DESC: Delete all Rhodes model objects for a source.For JavaScript you cannot specify conditions.

VALUE.DESC: returns all objects; can use optional :conditions.
returns the number of objects matching these :conditions.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: A name:value object that you want to find. Ex: conditions { name:'Symbol'}.

PARAM.name: order
PARAM.DESC: Attribute(s) to order the list. This cannot be used when using a select parameter and you must pass a conditions hash.

PARAM.name: orderdir
PARAM.DESC: Order direction. This cannot be used when using a select parameter and you must pass a conditions hash

PARAM.name: select
PARAM.DESC: Array of string attributes to return with the object. Useful if your model has many attributes and your query only needs a few of them. This cannot be used in combination with order or orderdir.

METHOD.name: make
METHOD.DESC: Create a new Rhodes model object JavaScript reference but does not save it to the database. To save this reference to the database, you will need to execute the .save() method. See the ORM new example.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes assigned to the new model object, such as {name:"ABC Inc.",address:"5555th St."}.

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Create a new Rhodes model object and save it to the database. This is the fastest way to insert a single item into the database.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes assigned to the new model object, such as {name : "ABC Inc.",address: "555 5th St."}.

METHOD.name: destroy
METHOD.DESC: Destroy a Rhodes model object and removes the record from the database.

METHOD.name: canModify
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if the Rhodes model object is not currently being synced (if it is being synced, you should disable editing of the object). Before displaying an edit page for an object, your application can check if the object is currently being accessed by the sync process. If it is, you should disable editing of the object. can_modify could return true, for example, on a new local record that was created and sent to the RhoConnect application, but no response has been received yet.

METHOD.name: vars
METHOD.DESC: Returns an object containing all propertyName and values for the model. You can use myModel.vars().name instead of myModel.get('name').

METHOD.name: object
METHOD.DESC: Returns the unique ID for the data record. Use this to identify records. You can also use this in a .find() method for retrieving a specific record.

METHOD.name: has
METHOD.DESC: Returns true or false if the model has the propertyName given.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property you are checking for validity. See also the vars() method.

METHOD.name: get
METHOD.DESC: Get the value of a property of the current model.Ex: myModel.get('name'); See also the vars() method.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property you are trying to retrieve.

RETURN.DESC: Value of the specified property from the database.

METHOD.name: set
METHOD.DESC: Sets the value of a property of the current model. Ex: myModel.set('name','new name'); This does not save to the database until you execute a myModel.save().

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property you are trying to set.

PARAM.name: propertyValue
PARAM.DESC: The value you are setting in the current model. After setting values you must issue a .save() in order for the data to be saved to the database.

METHOD.name: save
METHOD.DESC: Saves the current Rhodes model object to the database.

METHOD.name: updateAttributes
METHOD.DESC: Updates the current Rho model object attributes and saves it to the database. This is the fastest way to add or update model attributes.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes and their updated values, such as {name : "ABC Inc.",address: "555 5th St."}.

MODULE.PLATFORM: WM, CE, Win32, Android, iOS, WP8

EXAMPLE.title: ORM Make and Create Method Examples

SECTION.DESC: Use method make for creating a new ORM object and assign given attributes. Make does not save to the database until you execute a .save. To insert a new record right away use the create method instead.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var account = Account.make({name: "ABC Inc.", address: "555 5th St."}); account.get("name") // "ABC Inc."

SECTION.DESC: Use method Create for creating a new ORM object and save to the database.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var account = Account.create({name: "some new record", industry: "electronics"})
